metadata.Title: CVE-2014-8768 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - low
metadata.Description:
Multiple Integer underflows in the geonet_print function in tcpdump 4.5.0through 4.6.2, when in verbose mode, allow remote attackers to cause adenial of service (segmentation fault and crash) via a crafted length valuein a Geonet frame.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2014-8768` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

tcpdump - 4.5.1-2ubuntu1.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: tcpdump package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.5.1-2ubuntu1.1').
